skills.name: no-placeholders-production-code
skills.description: Enforce that all code output is production-ready with zero placeholders, stubs, mocks, or scaffolding. Scans for TODO, FIXME, stub, mock, placeholder, and similar anti-patterns. Validates code completeness, all error paths handled, configuration wired, and tests present.

skills.name: test-engineering-suite
skills.description: Implement comprehensive production-grade testing: unit tests (>60%), integration tests (20-30%), contract tests, property-based tests. Achieve >80% coverage. Write clear test names that describe behavior. Test all error paths explicitly. Include minimal repro tests for bugfixes.

skills.name: audit-first-commentary
skills.description: Ensure all code includes detailed, meaningful, audit-ready commentary that explains intent, invariants, tradeoffs, and design decisions. Every non-trivial function must document its contract and error handling. Module docstrings explain purpose and key types. Inline comments explain why, not just what.

skills.name: debuggable-by-default
skills.description: Ensure all code includes comprehensive debugging features: structured JSON logging with correlation IDs, assertions on invariants, diagnostic endpoints, and rich error objects. Make failures reproducible and root causes findable through logs, traces, and metrics.

skills.name: secure-by-default
skills.description: Implement security as a default: secrets never in code, all external input validated, output encoded, SQL parameterized, SSRF protection, least privilege, cryptography from standard libraries only, strong password hashing, short-lived tokens.

skills.name: refactor-with-safety
skills.description: Execute refactors safely: write comprehensive regression tests BEFORE refactoring, verify behavior identical with multiple techniques (regression tests, property tests, output comparison, benchmarks), make incremental changes, use feature flags for rollout, plan rollback.

skills.name: kaiza-mcp-ops
skills.description: Operate safely within Kaiza MCP: plan work before acting, request permissions via MCP gate, execute changes through MCP file APIs (no direct edits), run pre-flight checks (lint, typecheck, tests, security), verify results, produce audit summary with immutable trail.

skills.name: repo-understanding
skills.description: Quickly understand repository structure, conventions, architecture, and dependencies before making changes. Understand tech stack, key modules, testing strategy, quality gates, naming conventions, and known constraints. Document findings in workspace memory.

skills.name: release-readiness
skills.description: Verify code is production-ready before release: all quality gates pass, version numbers correct, changelog accurate, no breaking changes (or documented), deployment impact assessed, documentation current, staging tested, release notes written.

skills.name: observability-pack-implementer
skills.description: Implement standardized observability: structured JSON logging with correlation IDs, distributed tracing with span IDs, metrics collection (RED metrics), PII redaction policy, debug toggles and diagnostics endpoints, health/readiness checks.

skills.name: incident-triage-and-rca
skills.description: Rapidly diagnose and resolve production incidents: assess severity, gather data, form and test hypotheses, identify root cause, mitigate fast (revert/feature flag/scale), verify resolution, complete root cause analysis within 24 hours, implement prevention measures.
